verses.text: Open thy doors , O Lebanon , that the fire may devour thy cedars.

Howl , fir tree ; for the cedar is fallen ; because the mighty are spoiled : howl , O ye oaks of Bashan ; for the forest of the vintage is come down.\f + \fr 11.2 \ft mighty: or, gallants\f*\f + \fr 11.2 \ft the forest…: or, the defenced forest\f* \p
¶ \add There is\add* a voice of the howling of the shepherds ; for their glory is spoiled : a voice of the roaring of young lions ; for the pride of Jordan is spoiled. \p
Thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* my God ; Feed the flock of the slaughter ;

Whose possessors slay them, and hold themselves not guilty : and they that sell them say , Blessed \add be\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; for I am rich : and their own shepherds pity them not.

For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: but, lo, I will deliver the men every one into his neighbour’s hand , and into the hand of his king : and they shall smite the land , and out of their hand I will not deliver \add them\add*.\f + \fr 11.6 \ft deliver: Heb. make to be found\f*

And I will feed the flock of slaughter , \add even\add* you , O poor of the flock. And I took unto me two staves ; the one I called Beauty , and the other I called Bands ; and I fed the flock.\f + \fr 11.7 \ft even…: or, verily the poor\f*\f + \fr 11.7 \ft Bands: or, Binders\f*
Three shepherds also I cut off in one month ; and my soul lothed them, and their soul also abhorred me.\f + \fr 11.8 \ft lothed…: Heb. was straightened for them\f*

Then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth , let it die ; and that that is to be cut off , let it be cut off ; and let the rest eat every one the flesh of another.\f + \fr 11.9 \ft another: Heb. his fellow, or, neighbour\f* \p
¶ And I took my staff , \add even\add* Beauty , and cut it asunder , that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.

And it was broken in that day : and so the poor of the flock that waited upon me knew that it \add was\add* the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 11.11 \ft so…: or, the poor of the flock, etc. certainly knew\f*

And I said unto them, If ye think good , give \add me\add* my price ; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty \add pieces\add* of silver.\f + \fr 11.12 \ft If ye…: Heb. If it be good in your eyes\f*

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto me, Cast it unto the potter : a goodly price that I was prised at of them. And I took the thirty \add pieces\add* of silver , and cast them to the potter in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
Then I cut asunder mine other staff , \add even\add* Bands , that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.\f + \fr 11.14 \ft Bands: or, Binders\f* \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto me, Take unto thee yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.

For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land , \add which\add* shall not visit those that be cut off , neither shall seek the young one , nor heal that that is broken , nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat , and tear their claws in pieces.\f + \fr 11.16 \ft cut off: or, hidden\f*\f + \fr 11.16 \ft feed: or, bear\f*
Woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock ! the sword \add shall be\add* upon his arm , and upon his right eye : his arm shall be clean dried up , and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.
